article.headline: Butler 79, Youngstown State 59
article.story: YOUNGSTOWN, Ohio (AP) -- Brandon Polk scored 24 points to lead Butler to a 79-59 win over Youngstown State on Wednesday. Bruce Horan scored 13 points, and Avery Sheets and Jamie Smalligan added 12 each for the Bulldogs (12-14, 6-9 Horizon League), who led by as many as 25 points. Sheets also had seven assists. The Penguins (5-21, 2-13) trailed 44-32 at halftime, and opened the second half with a 3-pointer by Quin Humphrey to trim the lead to nine. But Butler responded with a 15-4 run over the next six minutes to make it 59-39 with 13:45 to play. Butler shot 59.2 percent from the field, and held Youngstown State to 46.8 percent shooting. Brian Radakovich led Youngstown State with 14 points, and Humphrey added 11. Khari McQueen and Derrik Harris added 10 each.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
